comment._content: Can't get enough of the lovely Princess Victoria Louise! en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess_Victoria_Louise_of_Prussia I believe Prince Ernst is the son of Archduke Franz Ferdinand, whose assassination sparked World War I. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Ernst_von_Hohenberg

comment.author: 90639512@N00
comment._content: BERLIN, Tuesday, Feb. 11. -- In an extra edition of the official Reichs-Anzeiger, issued this morning, the engagement of Princess Victoria Luise, the Kaiser's only daughter, to Prince Ernst August, son and heir of the Duke of Cumberland, is announced. This announcement means the termination of the long-standing feud between the houses of Hohenzollern and Cumberland NYT Article

comment._content: Prince Ernst ist Prince Ernst August from Hanover de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernst_August_(Braunschweig-L%c3%bcn... he was the youngest son of the last crown price of the kingdom of Hanover Ernst August, duke of Cumberland and princess Thyra of denmark, daugghter of king Christians IX.of Dänemark. He was born in 1887.

comment.author: 92436196@N06
comment._content: Ernst Augusts' father had rights to the throne of the Dukedom of Braunschweig. When he and Viktoria Luise married, his father gave up those rights in favor of his son. And so, in 1913, Ernst August and Viktoria became the reigning Duke and Duchess of Braunschweig and Lüneburg. (That used to be part of the kingdom of Hannover, which at that time was a prussian province. That stayed that way, only Braunschweig and Lüneburg became its own little Duchy.) Ernst August and Viktoria Luise only reigned until 1918. Did you know that through his mother Ernst August was closely related to the english and russian thrones? His mothers' sister Alexandra was Queen of England and his other aunt Dagmar was Empress of Russia. She took the name Maria Fjodorowna and was the mother of the last tsar Nicolaus II.
